home.title: Software developer, and tech enthusiast.
home.text: Hey, I’m Luis, a software developer and tech enthusiast based in Germany - Karlsruhe. I’m one of the lead developers at OneCalendar, where we strive to build software that empowers the digitalisation of businesses.

notFound.mainText: Sorry, we couldn’t find the page you’re looking for.

projects.title: All the things I have worked on over the last couple years.
projects.intro: In the last years I worked on quite a few projects with different programming languages and technologies. Some of them may not even be only technology related. But here I want to showcase all of my work, so you can get a glimpse of what I have done together with some amazing people.

onecalendar.description: Cloud based tool for managing appointments of small to mid sized businesses.

osmvalidation.description: Service for validating address data with OpenStreetMaps and providing a REST API for the results.

about.text1: As you stumbled upon this page, you probably want to know a little bit more about me. So here we go:
about.text2: As you probably noticed by now I’m in love with technology. But apart from that I also enjoy different kinds of sports like mountainbiking, climbing and powerlifting. I also enjoy spending quality time with my friends and family.
about.text3: My coding journey started when I was 17 years old working on some very small projects in Java and C++. My business informatics degree enabled me to learn a lot about different areas of computer science. About that time I really fell in love with web development and began to spend a huge potion of me free time learning about Typescript, Node.js and React. In addition I was able to gather knowledge in the field of requirements engineering, data migrations and integrations during my practical semesters at DIGITALL. While still working at some medium sized projects with Java I mostly enjoyed working on the bigger web projects with Typescript.
about.text4: Today I’m working as a Consultant for Data Integration & Migration and with my remaining time as a lead developer at OneCalendar. I really enjoy both professions as they come with their very own challenges and at the same time I benefit from the cross-functionality.
